page.title: 05Norton Cross Primary School
page.content: The school for the district is situated just over one kilometre from Skenfrith village in the area of Norton and is surrounded by fields and trees. It was built of stone 108 years ago,in 1877 and has a school house adjoining it where the caretaker now lives. Nineteen children between the ages of 4 and 11 attend the school.There is one headteacher and one assistant teacher. A school clerk works one day a week. The school is 16 metres long and 12 metres wide and has five rooms- two classrooms,one office,one play- room and a cloakroom.The Infants room measures 5m by 4m.The Junior children work in the main room which is 12m long and 6m wide.In this room there is a library area, a computer,a colour television and a cooker.
